terms.definition: Standard Operating Procedure - a documented process that outlines step-by-step instructions for completing routine tasks or activities consistently
A centralized web-based platform that provides access to an organization's documentation, procedures, and information resources
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents over time, allowing users to maintain multiple versions and revert to previous iterations
A web-based computing service that provides software, storage, and processing capabilities accessible from anywhere via the internet
Involving or affecting multiple departments, teams, or areas of expertise within an organization
The collective information, processes, and expertise that exists within an organization, often held by experienced employees
A sequence of connected steps or processes that move work from initiation to completion
Digital step-by-step instructions that allow users to input data and receive real-time guidance while completing procedures
Security features that determine which users can view, edit, or manage specific documents and systems
The ability to incorporate various content types like images, videos, audio files, and interactive elements into documentation
Data analysis tools that track user behavior, document usage, and performance metrics to provide insights for improvement
Application Programming Interface - a set of protocols that allows different software applications to communicate and share data
The process of integrating new employees into an organization by providing training, resources, and procedural knowledge
Adherence to laws, regulations, standards, and internal policies that govern how an organization operates
An individual with specialized knowledge, skills, and experience in a particular area or process within an organization
